messages.title: FAIR IS WORTH FIGHTING FOR
messages.content: Generations of Simon's family come from South Cambridgeshire. Simon was brought up in Bassingbourn and returned, after working in the charity sector, to establish the Guilden Gate smallholding with his wife Jacqui. Simon is 41 and has a 6 year old son George and a 6 year old daughter Maddie. He is passionate about creating a greener future.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon is passionate about creating a greener future. Greens offer new ideas and common sense policies for South Cambridgeshire.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Solar panels on every new home
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon supports the policy of installing solar panels on every new home.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Grants for insulation and energy efficiency
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon advocates for providing grants for insulation and improving energy efficiency.
Simon proposes village housing trusts to provide more really local affordable housing.

issues.environment: Simon is passionate about creating a greener future.

housing.content: Simon proposes village housing trusts to provide more really local affordable housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: I joined the Greens because I wanted a real alternative to the main parties. The Green Party is not just about the environment - it has a full range of practical policies aimed at achieving a better quality of life. Rather than voting for 'business as usual' please vote Green and play a part in creating a brighter, greener future for our children.

quotes.text: Vote Green to get a fairer deal for the people of South Cambridgeshire

images.caption: Simon Saggers with family on his smallholding in Bassingbourn.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Printed on 100% recycled paper using sustainable practices.
